page.title: 13HANGING GROVE FARM
page.content: {HANGING GROVE FARM IS A DAIRY FARM. They have 150 acres for 330 cows.Every morning Mr Pearce and his son get up at 04.45 and start work at 05.00. When a calf is born they keep it at the farm in the cowshed for 8-10 weeks to make sure that it is healthy and to have its horns burnt off. After that it is allowed back in the field with its mum. Mr.Pearce also has 40 sheep. They have to dip the sheep twice a year round about July and August and then again between September and November. The sheep are dipped to keep them healthy.
